reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 66/20: INFECTIOUS DISEASE EMERGENCY LEAVE

content.content: 1. For the purposes of section 50.1 of the Act, the following diseases are designated as infectious diseases: 1. Diseases caused by a novel coronavirus, including Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS), Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Coronavirus (COVID-19).
content.raw_html:
1. For the purposes of section 50.1 of the Act, the following diseases are designated as infectious diseases:

1. Diseases caused by a novel coronavirus, including Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS), Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Coronavirus (COVID-19).

content.content: 2. Entitlement to emergency leave under clause 50.1 (1.1) (b) of the Act because of a reason related to Coronavirus (COVID-19) is deemed to have started on January 25, 2020.
content.raw_html: 2. Entitlement to emergency leave under clause 50.1 (1.1) (b) of the Act because of a reason related to Coronavirus (COVID-19) is deemed to have started on January 25, 2020.

content.content: 3. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).
